pullRequest.body:
We show the isomorphism between `Z(R)` and `End(1 Mod-R)`

---

if it passes the continuous integration checks.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|1406|1|erw|

Current commit [5f6723d3a8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/5f6723d3a8423512d620655dc3e602b5e23d7a06)
Reference commit [3c77579087](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/3c775790879b6d19b243e0f816683e04e6b0a98b)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Maybe the location of this file is wrong, after all it did not use any `RingCat`
The universes `v` and `v'` are here is to make sure this definition is compatible with `IsMoritaEquivalent` in #20640
Can you extract this? `*`  should be more generally true for any equivalence of categories, and `+` needs an additive equivalence probably?

Can you use [Module.moduleEndSelf](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/LinearMap/End.html#Module.moduleEndSelf)? Then this is basically Z(Module.End R R) = Z(R^mop) = Z(R).
I am not sure I follow. Is the idea that constructing a ring isomorphism between `Z(Module.End R R)` and `CategoryTheory.End ( (ModuleCat R))` is easier?
Can you use `Small` rather than `max v u`? Same below.

Apparently this can be a combination of [CategoryTheory.Functor.FullyFaithful.mulEquivEnd](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Endomorphism.html#CategoryTheory.Functor.FullyFaithful.mulEquivEnd), [CategoryTheory.Equivalence.congrLeft/Right](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Equivalence.html#CategoryTheory.Equivalence.congrRight) and [CategoryTheory.Iso.conj](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Conj.html#CategoryTheory.Iso.conj).

```suggestion
noncomputable def endMonoidEquiv
    (sq : e.congrLeft.functor.obj f  e'.congrRight.inverse.obj g) : End f * End g :=
  ((e.congrLeft.fullyFaithfulFunctor).mulEquivEnd f).trans <|
    sq.conj.trans
    ((e'.congrRight.fullyFaithfulInverse).mulEquivEnd g).symm
```

[stacks#0DLP](https://stacks.math.columbia.edu/tag/0DLP) says that a functor between preadditive categories [with binary biproducts](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Biproducts.html#ModuleCat.instHasBinaryBiproducts) that preserves either binary coproducts or binary products ([`Limits.PreservesLimitsOfShape (Discrete Limits.WalkingPair)`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Closed/Ideal.html#CategoryTheory.preservesBinaryProducts_of_exponentialIdeal)) (in particular if it's an equivalence) is automatically additive. Can you refactor the proof through that? That would also enable us to remove the additivity condition from the definition of Morita equivalence.

`sq` is defeq to `e.inverse  f  g  e'.inverse`, which is not very natural. How about:
```suggestion
noncomputable def endMonoidEquiv (sq : f  e'.functor  e.functor  g) : End f * End g :=
  (e'.congrRight.fullyFaithfulFunctor.mulEquivEnd f).trans <| sq.conj.trans
    (e.congrLeft.fullyFaithfulInverse.mulEquivEnd g).symm
```
(This is done in my branch.)

It's nice that Lean already knows `additive_of_preserves_binary_products`; however I think it's better to keep the original `Additive` assumptions since they are more general. It turns out we only need that `e'` is additive, see [my branch](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/5d78a65d1cfbdbf1e53849feb395930e59ca58e1).
I've realized [my comment](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20652/files#r1937614282) was misplaced and doesn't really belong to this PR.

pullRequest.title: feat: categorical description of center of a ring
